world

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Entity>
          • world.World
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Entity>, java.util.Collection<Entity>, java.util.List<Entity>, java.util.RandomAccess

    public class World
extends java.util.ArrayList<Entity>
    A class of worlds describing the game world of a game of Asteroids.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • canHaveAsSize

        private boolean canHaveAsSize(double size)
        Checks whether this world can have the given size as a component of its size.
        Parameters:
        size - The given size.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given size is strictly positive and at most the max value for a double. | ((size > 0) && (size <= Double.MAX_VALUE))

      • evolve

        public void evolve(double dt,
          CollisionListener coll)
        Evolves the state of this world by a given time period and a collision detector. Also needs a collision listener to render explosions.
        Parameters:
        dt - The time difference over which to evolve this world.
        coll - The required collision listener.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        | position.x <= this.x && position.x >= 0 && position.y <= this.y && position.y <= this.y

      • isInWorld

        private boolean isInWorld(Entity entity)
        Checks whether the given entity is within the world.
        Parameters:
        entity - The given entity
        Returns:
        True if and only if the entity is not null and every edge of the shape is in the world. //TODO | result == (entity != null) | && isInWorld(entity.getPosition().getSum(new Vector(entity.getShape().getRadius(), 0))) | && isInWorld(entity.getPosition().getSum(new Vector(-entity.getShape().getRadius(), 0))) | && isInWorld(entity.getPosition().getSum(new Vector(0, entity.getShape().getRadius()))); | && isInWorld(entity.getPosition().getSum(new Vector(0, -entity.getShape().getRadius())));

      • isSpaceForEntity

        private boolean isSpaceForEntity(Entity entity)
        Checks whether there is space in the world to add the given entity
        Parameters:
        entity - The given entity
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given entity is null or does not overlap with any other entity. | (entity == null) || for (Entity e : this) (!entity.overlapsWith(e))
